recommendations.recommendation: A well executed anime of the cutesy and funny "school girl daily life" genre. Main characters are well introduced and not overwealming in numbers. They got the Mahou Shoujo style in it the series, but no wierd side szenarios, which makes them fight apocalypse. Funny moments, heartwarming moments and a bit of drama makes it the thing you want to watch, when your are fan of the genre.

anime.description: On a spring day when the cherry blossoms have started to fall, the naïve princess of a small country, http://anidb.net/ch89196 [Lion] begins her days at a school in Hokkaido. The school houses a special facility run by ALCA that trains Logicalists who protect the peace of the world. Lion has a lot of unique classmates in Class 1-S, including http://anidb.net/ch89194 [Nina], a Logicalist. This is the story of the energetic and adorable days the Logicalists-in-training spend together. It`s time to Trance! Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: magical girl
tag.description: Magical girls (also known both in Japan and in the West as mahou shoujo, and in Japan as majokko) are young girls with superhuman abilities of magical nature. In the early years, magical girls usually used magic to solve everyday problems and often transformed into idols; nowadays, however, the term is most often used to refer to with girls who fight evil using magical powers, and, although transformations are still common, they tend to be more along the lines of a change of costume.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: shoujo ai
tag.description: Shoujo Ai means girls love, and thus explores what happens when two girls (or women) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2695 [Yuri] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphic sex. The male version is http://anidb.net/t2783 [Shounen Ai]. http://anidb.net/t7146 [Cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] is often mistaken as low level Yuri or Shoujo Ai. If there is no Yuri or Shoujo Ai subtext, i.e. if there is no romantic subtext, only tag CGDCT. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: henshin
tag.description: Japanese for "transformation" (metamorphosis or disguise). A "henshin anime" is any anime, where the characters or their costumes transform, such as Sailor Moon. The henshin switches on the character`s special powers, and is frequently accompanied by a costume change. Often the change of clothing is the only outward indicator that the character has changed and yet nobody seems to notice the hero`s true self. Most henshin heroes have a special item which they use to change into their heroic form. These items are usually activated by a command phrase (which is often in Engrish, for some reason), triggering a transformation sequence.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: fighting
tag.description: For some reason or other one faction has to take it out on some opponent via fight or battle. Typical examples of this are all the anime with "endless pointless fighting" tag.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

tag.name: intact family
tag.description: The main character`s family is a so-called "nuclear family". Wherein both parents are alive and present in his or her life. This is actually relatively rare for anime, where "parental abandonment" is the norm.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: unrequited shoujo ai
tag.description: At least one female character has a romantic or sexual interest in another female character, but the feelings are not returned. This can be because the recipient is oblivious, straight, or simply not interested.

episode.title: 恩を花で返す
Repay Kindness with Flowers
Payer ses dettes en fleurs
은혜를 꽃으로 갚다
On o Hana de Kaesu
episode.summary: Class S faces their first practical exam. Yayoi is aiming for first place, and gets even more enthusiastic when she hears the examiners will be Logicalists currently in active duty. However Yayoi`s biggest rival, Nina, seems to be more concerned about Lion than her. And so the chaotic practical exam starts. Who will take first place? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 白銀のグリズリー -子の心親知らず-
The Silver Grizzly: There Is No Love Like a Child`s
Le grizzly d`argent (comprendre son enfant)
백은의 그리즐리: 아이의 마음을 부모는 모른다
Shirogane no Grizzly: Ko no Kokoro Oyashirazu
episode.summary: Lion and her friends are enjoying a tea party in Yuko`s room when they unexpectedly learn the date of her birthday. What`s more, it`s today! Yayoi proposes throwing a surprise party for Yuko, and Lion remembers that Yuko once said she wanted to have a pajama party. To buy a birthday present for Yuko, Lion heads to Pirari Town to visit it for her first time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 合体は一日にしてならず / 花よりおにぎり
Transforming Is Not Mastered in a Day / Rice Balls over Flowers
L`union doit être faite / Du riz plutôt que des fleurs
합체는 하루아침에 이루어지지 않는다 / 금강산도 주먹밥 먹고나서
Gattai wa Ichinichi ni Shite Narazu / Hana yori Onigiri
episode.summary: After just one night at the academy, Lion finds tests waiting for her in the morning. Lion is disheartened after some very disappointing grades. She cheers up after talking with Yuko and all her friends in the student council while eating Yuko`s home made cookies. And so she goes to face her first covenant. How will Rosa react to Lion`s feelings towards her? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かわいいヒナには旅をさせろ
Send Your Cute Hina on a Journey!
Envoyez les jolis poussins explorer !
귀여운 히나는 여행을 보내라
Kawaii Hina ni wa Tabi o Saseru
episode.summary: Lion is a princess from a small country who has enrolled in Pirari Academy which is in Hokkaido. She was looking forward to starting her fun new school life with Nina, the girl she admires most... but something is amiss. Lion seems to be missing something important that she must have to be enrolled in class S. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending
Opening
夢は成功のもと
Success Comes from Dreaming
Les rêves mènent à la réussite
꿈은 성공의 어머니
Yume wa Seikou no Moto
episode.summary: The long summer break is over and the second semester starts. Pirari Academy is having its first ever school festival, and Lion and her friends think about what kind of event they should do. Everyone agrees on Mahiro`s idea to do a play. Mahiro starts working on the script at once, but writing easy as she thinks... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 会長も木から落ちる / 踊るヒナに見る会長
Even Presidents Fall from Trees / You`re a Hina If You Dance, and a President If You Just Look On
La présidente qui tombe de l`arbre / La présidente et les poussins dansant
회장도 나무에서 떨어진다 / 춤추는 히나에 보는 회장(피장파장)
Kaichou mo Ki kara Ochiru / Odoru Hina ni Miru Kaichou
episode.summary: It`s the second half of summer break and Yuko is spending her days at Shirakaba Dormitory as usual. But Yuko is worried about what her plans for the future should be. Her friends on the student council try to give her a pep talk, and Mizuki tells Yuko what her dream is. At the same time, the yearly traditional Pirari Town Bon Dance competition is tomorrow. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 寝るヒナは育つ
Sleep Brings up a Hina Well
Les poussins grandissent en dormant
잘 자는 히나는 잘 큰다
Neru Hina wa Sodatsu
episode.summary: With the exams over, Lion approaches her first ever summer break. Lion`s friends come to her home to enjoy their vacation. What kind of fun memories will Lion create with her first trip with her friends? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 千里の道も努力から
A Journal of a Thousand Miles Begins with Effort
L`entraide fait toute la différence
천리길도 노력부터
Senri no Michi mo Doryoku kara
episode.summary: It`s first year class S`s first practical exam. Yayoi intends to take first place, and when she hears Logicalists currently on active duty are going to participate in the practical exam, she puts even more effort into her goal. However, her biggest rival Nina seems to be more concerned about Lion. And so the practical exam starts, filled with ups and downs. Who will get first place? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 笑うヒナには福きたる
Good Fortune Will Come to Hinas Who Smile
Poussin rieur attire le bonheur
웃는 히나에 복이 온다
Warau Hina ni wa Fuku Kitaru
episode.summary: ALCA has finally finished deliberating over the ncident that happened at the end of December. Fortunately, they have decided that no one will be punished for what happened, and actually consider Nina`s actions at the time to be worthy of praise. So much so that they`ve asked to see Nina for an interview. Nina has finally gotten her big break, but how do Lion and the rest of her friends feel about it? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一年の計はカウントダウンにあり / 据えチョコ食わぬは女の恥
The Countdown Is the Time to Plan Your Year Around / Shameful Is She Who Spurns Chocolate
Compte à rebours de l`année / Les femmes ne résistent pas au chocolat
일년의 계획은 카운트다운에 세워라 / 차려놓은 쵸코렛도 못 먹는건 여자의 수치
Ichinen no Kei wa Countdown ni Ari / Sue Choco Kuwanu wa Onna no Haji
episode.summary: With the exams over, Pirari Academy enters the winter break. Everyone at the dorm heads home for New Year`s Eve, leaving Nina alone to fully enjoy some peace and quiet. Join her and the rest of Pirari Academy as they relax on New Year`s Eve. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 涙は己のためならず
Our Tears Are Not for Our Own Benefit
Pleurer pour les autres
눈물은 나를 위한 것이 아니다
Namida wa Ore no Tame Narazu
episode.summary: It`s December, and winter is finally upon all the students. The practical exam at the end of the semester will be a tournament, and Lion`s first match is against Nina. Meanwhile, Nina is becoming more and more flustered about figuring about how she can prove herself to ALCA to make her way back. Holding her frustrations in her heart, she heads towards the exam, but what results will she find? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 歌はヒナにつれヒナは歌につれ
Songs Change with Hinas, and Hinas Change with Song
Les poussins sont faits pour chanter
히나에 따라 노래도 변하고, 노래에 따라 히나도 변하고
Uta wa Hina ni Tsure Hina wa Uta ni Tsure
episode.summary: Pirari Festival is nearly here, and the script for the play Lion and everyone in Class S is going to perform is complete. Everyone`s busy getting everything ready and rehearsing, but Lion, who`s playing the leading role, just can`t seem to get any better at playing her role, no matter how much she practices. Nobody can figure out what to do until they stumble upon an unlikely solution. Now that the day of the festival is finally here, will Lion and her class make their play a success? Source: crunchyroll
